snippet: Judge Edward R. Korman, who berated the government for limiting the use of a morning-after pill, calls himself “a compassionate conservative,” but his politics are hard to pin down.
abstract: Profile of Judge Edward R Korman, who berated the government for limiting the use of a morning-after pill and placing politics over science; his compassion, notable in courtroom speeches that have moved his audience to tears, springs from his upbringing as a son of Jewish immigrants who sacrificed their own education to give their only child opportunities and sacrifices he made for his own two children, especially his 30-year-old daughter who suffers from autism.
lead_paragraph: Judge Edward R. Korman, who berated the government for limiting the use of a morning-after pill, calls himself “a compassionate conservative,” but his politics are hard to pin down.

headline.main: Behind Scolding of the F.D.A., a Complex and Gentle Judge
headline.print_headline: Judge in Contraceptives Case: Tough, but Hard to Pigeonhole
